intro: Lactuca oyukludaghensis, commonly known as the Oyukludagh endive, is a rare species of lettuce native to Turkey. It is characterized by its curly, dark green leaves that resemble those of other endive varieties. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features include a rosette growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
